trans-unit.source: Represents a media type used in a Content-Type header as defined in the RFC 2616.

The <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue> class provides support for the media type used in a Content-Type header as defined in [RFC 2616](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=241642) by the IETF.
An example of a media-type would be "text/plain; charset=iso-8859-5.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> object used to initialize the new instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> class.
The source represented as a string to initialize the new instance.
Gets or sets the character set.
The character set.
Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> object.
The object to compare with the current object.
`true` if the specified <xref href="System.Object"></xref> is equal to the current object; otherwise, `false`.
Serves as a hash function for an <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> object.
A hash code is a numeric value that is used to identify an object during equality testing.
It can also serve as an index for an object in a collection.
The <xref:System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue.GetHashCode%2A> method is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
A hash code for the current object.
Gets or sets the media-type header value.
The media-type is used in the Content-Type and Accept header fields in order to provide open and extensible data typing and type negotiation.
The media-type header value.
Gets or sets the media-type header value parameters.
The media-type header value parameters.
Converts a string to an <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> instance.
A string that represents media type header value information.
A <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> instance.
input is a `null` reference.
input is not valid media type header value information.
Returns a string that represents the current <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> object.
A string that represents the current object.
Determines whether a string is valid <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> information.
The string to validate.
The <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> version of the string.
`true` if input is valid information; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a new object that is a copy of the current <xref href="System.Net.Http.Headers.MediaTypeHeaderValue"></xref> instance.
A copy of the current instance.
